009package imagingbook.common.morphology;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.process.Blitter;
013import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015
016public class BinaryDilation extends BinaryMorphologyFilter {
017        
018        public BinaryDilation() {
019                super();
020        }
021                        
022        public BinaryDilation(byte[][] H) {
023                super(H);
024        }
025        
026        public void applyTo(ByteProcessor ip) {
027                //assume that the hot spot of H is at its center (ic,jc)
028                int xc = (H[0].length - 1) / 2;
029                int yc = (H.length - 1) / 2;
030                int N = H.length * H[0].length;
031                
032                ImageProcessor tmp = ip.createProcessor(ip.getWidth(), ip.getHeight());
033                
034                int k = 0;
035                IJ.showProgress(k, N);
036                for (int j = 0; j < H.length; j++) {
037                        for (int i = 0; i < H[j].length; i++) {
038                                if (H[j][i] > 0) { // this element is set
039                                        // copy image into position (u-ch,v-cv)
040                                        tmp.copyBits(ip, i - xc, j - yc, Blitter.MAX);
041                                }
042                                IJ.showProgress(k++, N);
043                        }
044                }
045                ip.copyBits(tmp, 0, 0, Blitter.COPY);
046        }
047
048}
